intro: Astragalus tehuelches, commonly known as the Tehuelche milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system. Its leaves are usually compound, and it produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Astragalus tehuelches plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
